newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil publishes Cemig tender details.
newsitem.headline: Brazil publishes Cemig tender details.

text.p: Brazil's BNDESPar on Wednesday published the tender documents to sell off debentures convertible to Minas Gerais state power firm Cemig common shares.
BNDESPar is the investment wing of Brazil's National Development Bank (BNDES).
A total of 18.7 million debentures, convertible to a 32.9 percent voting stake in Cemig, will be auctioned off in a block sale for a minimum price of 60.37 reais per debenture to a strategic partner.
The auction will take place on the Rio de Janeiro Stock Exchange (BVRJ) at a date still to be set. The sale may take place 45 days after the publication of the bid specifications.

Brazil's Minas Gerais state, which owns a majority stake in Cemig, had previously planned to sell the shares but scrapped its plans after the National Development Bank (BNDES) decided not to extend the deadline for repayment of a 430 million-real state debt.
BNDES granted the loan in early 1996 and was issued convertible debentures. The first repayment tranche was due October 31, 1996.

As a result of the decision not to grant an extension, the shares were transferred to BNDES Participacoes (BNDESPar), the investment wing of BNDES, which are now putting them into sale by auctioning off the debentures.
Domestic and foreign Investors will have to pre-qualify for the auction on March 31, according to the tender-documents.
Several foreign groups have shown interest in Cemig, particularly U.S. Southern Co and Chile's Enersis.
